docs.lead_paragraph: More than 110 cases of viral meningitis, a nonfatal disease of the nervous system, have been reported this year by public and private health officials. The city Department of Health said that the total probably represented the largest number of cases reported at one time since the department first began keeping figures on the disease in 1959.

headline.main: 50 Bronx Children Hospitalized In Outbreak of Viral Meningitis; 110 Cases Reported in City So Far This Year--Disease Nonfatal, Officials Say

docs.abstract: Residents of Morrisania sec of Bronx, NYC, cite stagnant water from clogged sewers as cause of recent outbreak of viral meningitis in area
docs.snippet: More than 110 cases of viral meningitis, a nonfatal disease of the nervous system, have been reported this year by public  and private health officials. The city Department of Health said that the total probably represented the largest number of...

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON A few years ago, a truck collided with a bus on a highway. Nine people were killed and many were injured. Investigators found that the truck driver had been heavily dosed with amphetamine and that he had not slept for 49 hours; possibly, he had simply blacked out when the drug's effect wore off.

headline.main: Move to Curb the Widespread Use of 'Pep Pills'

docs.abstract: article on FDA moving to restrict allowable med claims for amphetamines to 3 uses: treatment of narcolepsy, hyperactivity in brain-damaged children and short-term use as aid to obesity
